page.title: 09BALBY CARR SCHOOL DONCASTER
page.content: The school is the result of Doncaster'S recent reorganisation of secondary education. It occupies the site of the old Woodfield High School at the end of Weston Rd. but new modern buildings were added and opened in 1983 to accomodate more pupils 13 to 16 years old, a 6th form and a youth club. There is room for about 1200 pupils. The school day begins at 9.15 am with form or year group assemblies. The morning's lessons are divided into 4 periods of 35 mins. and a 15 min. break from 10.50 to 11.05 am. Afternoon school begins at 1.25 pm and consists of 4 periods with a break from 2.40 to 2.55 pm. After day school hours the buildings are used by adult education groups and for youth clubs, discos and sporting activities
